availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Howard (Ghent, Carroll County, Kentucky farmer and grocer.)

body.p: Ghent, Carroll County, Kentucky, farmer and grocer. Indiana native. Married to Elizabeth Howard. Father of Lydia B. Howard, Louisa Howard, Ida Howard, Edward B. Howard, Henry B. Howard, and Fannie Howard. Owned two enslaved persons in Carroll County in 1850. Grocer in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Carroll County in 1860. Farmer in Carroll County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 1, p. 171B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, District 1, p. 86.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, p. 40A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, p. 893
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, p. 240B
